# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can write the function `wrap_string`:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s)
    result = String[]

    for word in words
        if length(result) > 0 && length(word) + length(join(result)) > text_width
            push!(result, "\n")
        end
        push!(result, word)
    end

    return join(result, " ")
end
```
This function splits the input string into words. It then iterates over these words and checks if adding the current word to the result would exceed `text_width`. If so, it adds a new line (`"\n"`) to the result array. It then adds the current word to the result array. Finally, it joins all elements of `result` into one string with spaces in between.

For instance:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet", 10))
```

This will output:

```shell
Lorem
ipsum
dolor
sit
amet
```
